PySide Mobility {{ version }}

Qt Mobility is a project within Nokia that is creating a new suite of Qt APIs for mobile device functionality.

PySide Mobility is a set of bindings that allows Python to access Qt Mobility API. It was created using the Shiboken binding generator and depends on PySide libraries.

Modules

Bearer
An API to control the system's connectivity state. Since Qt 4.7, QtBearer functionality is provided directly in QtNetwork.

Contacts
An API enabling clients to request contact data from local or remote backends.

Connectivity
The Connectivity API facilitates communication with local devices.

Feedback
An API enabling a client to provide tactile and audio feedback to user actions.

Gallery
An API to navigate and query documents using their meta-data.

Location
The Location API provides a library for distributing and receiving location data using arbitrary data sources.

Messaging
The Messaging API enables access to messaging services.

MultimediaKit
Provides a set of APIs to play and record media, and manage a collection of media content. Note: The Multimedia API, together with QtMultimedia, is intended to eventually replace the Phonon API.

Organizer
An API enabling clients to request calendar, schedule and personal data from local or remote backends.

PublishSubscribe
The Publish and Subscribe API, containing Value Space, enables applications to read item values, navigate through and subscribe to change notifications.

Sensors
The Sensors API provides access to sensors.

ServiceFramework
A set of Qt APIs that allows clients to discover and instantiate arbitrary services.

System Information
A set of APIs to discover system related information and capabilities.

Versit
An API to manage Versit (VCards) documents.
